entry.title: HTML5 App published but not showing in Work Zone Content Manager
entry.content:
Hi,

I followed the following tutorial on the trial account to publish my Incident Management App created using Business Application Studio, while testing the CAP development, as made from the previous tutorials of this one:

Deploy to CF 

Everything went as expected, my cf apps command in then BAS  Terminal returning the 2 apps, as in the screenshot of the tutorial, and my cf services  command returns 4 services, because HANA Cloud has been moved from space to subaccount section.

 

However, I still do not see my app within the Content Manager of Work Zone, as mentioned in the following tutorial:

Integrate with Work Zone 

 

What could be the reason?

 

Following are the screenshots of my Role Collections, Subaccount Instances, CF Space and Work Zone Content Manager.

 

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Opening transaction in SAPGUI for HTML via URL fails (sometimes)
entry.content:
Hello, I would like to open the transaction QM02 (Edit Quality Notification) in the web browser for a certain quality notification number by clicking an link. SAP provides a target mapping for this:

  • Catalog: X-SAP-UI2-ADCAT:SAP_TC_QM_BE_APPS:S4QM
  • Semantic Objekt and Action: QualityNotification-change
  • Target: Transaction QM02

The following URL parameters are intended for this navigation:

  • QualityNotification > Mapped to dynpro target field RIWO00-QMNUM
  • DynproNoFirstScreen > Mapped to DYNP_NO1ST (=1)
  • sap-tag & sap-ach

The link therefore looks like this:

https://<host>/sap/bc/ui5_ui5/ui2/ushell/shells/abap/FioriLaunchpad.html?sap-client=
<client>#QualityNotification-change?QualityNotification=000230000001

When clicking this link, in about 50% of the attempts it works just as expected. SAPGUI for HTML opens with QM02, selection screen is skipped and the quality notification provided in the URL is opened. I can simple change the notification number from 000230000001 to 000230000002 and it will open this one instead. Everything works perfectly smooth just as expected:

However, in the other 50% of attempts, instead of directly opening the transaction, the following selection popup is displayed instead:

When the user closes the dialog, he simply sees the main selection screen of QM02. Now, when he enters a quality notification number manually, the transaction works fine. But, if he now clicks another link to open QM02 for a different notification, it will always open the notification he entered first in the session:

This is very dangerous as it will lead to the user editing the wrong notification. 
It feels like instead of creating a new session for QM02, an existing session is reused and therefore the notification number provided from the URL is ignored.

My questions are: 

  • Why is the behavior so inconsistent? 
  • What can I do to have the invoke of QM02 in the browser work every time?

What I already tried (with the same inconsistent behavior all the time): 

  • Trying different quality notifications
  • Trying with different users/logins
  • Trying in different systems and clients (dev/test/prod)
  • Trying in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, ...) and clearing cache
  • Trying with fresh browser restart and existing browser session
  • Trying with another SAP GUI session (NWBC) open in the background (or not)
  • Trying with different authentication methods (username/password or SSO)

My system: 

  • SAP S/4HANA 2023 SAP SP01
  • S/4HANA FOUNDATION 2023
  • SAP FIORI FES 2023 FOR S/4HANA
  • SAP FIORI FOR SAP
  • S/4HANA 2023 ABAP PLATFORM 2023
  • SAPUI5: 1.120.25

entry.title: HTML validation error in User Settings of LMS
entry.content:
Hi,

I‚Äôm trying to do some setting changes in User settings page of Learning administration-->application administration.

To enable/disable settings I‚Äôm getting Validation error for as ‚ÄúThe HTML Text you entered is not supported.‚Äù We have custom HTML code used, and it was working fine but to disable one feature now this error is showing up in the user login panel.

I‚Äôve tried multiple ways to change the tags as per few KB‚Äôs but couldn‚Äôt succeed.  Can anyone please suggest/support here.

entry.title: Multitenant App is not able to load $metadata of backend service (401 Unauthorized)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to develop a CAP Multitenant application which is simply returning an UI, where you can see custom Information for a specific Job.

Therefore I tried to setup based on my cds schema a Fiori Elements application which should simply display a view fields of my schema.

So far the Mutlitenant subscription is working and I also can get on the UI, but once I try to reach the application the router returns the following.

2025-04-22T15:48:46.93+0000 [RTR/2] OUT oem-stest-test-y8zx6ymv-tddoemdev-datasphere-kdtaskprocessor.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com - [2025-04-22T15:48:46.704077202Z] "GET /mytpsubprocesslogging/manifest.json?sap-language=DE HTTP/2.0" 200 0 1396 "https://oem-stest-test-y8zx6ymv-tddoemdev-datasphere-kdtaskprocessor.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/mytpsubprocesslogging/index.html" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/135.0.0.0" "10.0.200.1:14802" "10.0.201.46:61066" x_forwarded_for:"X.X.X.X, 10.0.200.1" x_forwarded_proto:"https" vcap_request_id:"66062ba8-1804-460e-4806-3db88aa2e7b7" response_time:0.232343 gorouter_time:0.000070 app_id:"2fd98ee6-da82-4340-bd30-a68d1f0c0ea9" app_index:"0" instance_id:"dfe286a1-4d1b-4bec-46fa-8443" failed_attempts:0 failed_attempts_time:"-" dns_time:0.000000 dial_time:0.000855 tls_time:0.003031 backend_time:0.232273 local_address:"10.0.129.8:53350" x_cf_routererror:"-" x_correlationid:"-" tenantid:"-" sap_passport:"-" x_scp_request_id:"6558a066-0a7f-44d1-bdc0-98ebe7799e5e-6807BA5D-4F95DC2" x_cf_app_instance:"-" x_forwarded_host:"-" x_custom_host:"-" x_ssl_client:"-" x_ssl_client_session_id:"-" x_ssl_client_verify:"-" x_ssl_client_subject_dn:"-" x_ssl_client_subject_cn:"-" x_ssl_client_issuer_dn:"-" x_ssl_client_notbefore:"-" x_ssl_client_notafter:"-" x_cf_forwarded_url:"-" traceparent:"-" true_client_ip:"-" x_cf_true_client_ip:"X.X.X.X" x_request_id:"-" x_b3_traceid:"66062ba81804460e48063db88aa2e7b7" x_b3_spanid:"48063db88aa2e7b7" x_b3_parentspanid:"-" b3:"66062ba81804460e48063db88aa2e7b7-48063db88aa2e7b7"

2025-04-22T15:48:47.07+0000 [RTR/1] OUT oem-stest-test-y8zx6ymv-tddoemdev-datasphere-kdtaskprocessor.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com - [2025-04-22T15:48:47.035400537Z] "GET /mytpsubprocesslogging/odata/v4/task-processor/$metadata?sap-language=DE HTTP/2.0" 401 0 22 "https://oem-stest-test-y8zx6ymv-tddoemdev-datasphere-kdtaskprocessor.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/mytpsubprocesslogging/index.html" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/135.0.0.0" "10.0.200.1:39814" "10.0.201.46:61066" x_forwarded_for:"X.X.X.X, 10.0.200.1" x_forwarded_proto:"https" vcap_request_id:"2c40e8d0-7e35-49af-4a20-8c69e62b89fa" response_time:0.039553 gorouter_time:0.000158 app_id:"2fd98ee6-da82-4340-bd30-a68d1f0c0ea9" app_index:"0" instance_id:"dfe286a1-4d1b-4bec-46fa-8443" failed_attempts:0 failed_attempts_time:"-" dns_time:0.000000 dial_time:0.001068 tls_time:0.003747 backend_time:0.039394 local_address:"10.0.65.9:16788" x_cf_routererror:"-" x_correlationid:"-" tenantid:"-" sap_passport:"-" x_scp_request_id:"6558a066-0a7f-44d1-bdc0-98ebe7799e5e-6807BA5E-4F95EEF" x_cf_app_instance:"-" x_forwarded_host:"-" x_custom_host:"-" x_ssl_client:"-" x_ssl_client_session_id:"-" x_ssl_client_verify:"-" x_ssl_client_subject_dn:"-" x_ssl_client_subject_cn:"-" x_ssl_client_issuer_dn:"-" x_ssl_client_notbefore:"-" x_ssl_client_notafter:"-" x_cf_forwarded_url:"-" traceparent:"-" true_client_ip:"-" x_cf_true_client_ip:"X.X.X.X" x_request_id:"-" x_b3_traceid:"2c40e8d07e3549af4a208c69e62b89fa" x_b3_spanid:"4a208c69e62b89fa" x_b3_parentspanid:"-" b3:"2c40e8d07e3549af4a208c69e62b89fa-4a208c69e62b89fa"
   
2025-04-22T15:48:47.07+0000 [RTR/1] OUT oem-stest-test-y8zx6ymv-tddoemdev-datasphere-kdtaskprocessor.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com - [2025-04-22T15:48:47.037185405Z] "HEAD /mytpsubprocesslogging/odata/v4/task-processor/ HTTP/2.0" 401 0 0 "https://oem-stest-test-y8zx6ymv-tddoemdev-datasphere-kdtaskprocessor.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/mytpsubprocesslogging/index.html" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/135.0.0.0" "10.0.200.1:39814" "10.0.201.46:61066" x_forwarded_for:"X.X.X.X, 10.0.200.1" x_forwarded_proto:"https" vcap_request_id:"c503eb89-9907-4582-7ce6-91a6c605e2cb" response_time:0.039143 gorouter_time:0.000095 app_id:"2fd98ee6-da82-4340-bd30-a68d1f0c0ea9" app_index:"0" instance_id:"dfe286a1-4d1b-4bec-46fa-8443" failed_attempts:0 failed_attempts_time:"-" dns_time:0.000000 dial_time:0.001004 tls_time:0.003917 backend_time:0.039049 local_address:"10.0.65.9:16796" x_cf_routererror:"-" x_correlationid:"-" tenantid:"-" sap_passport:"-" x_scp_request_id:"6558a066-0a7f-44d1-bdc0-98ebe7799e5e-6807BA5F-4F95EF0" x_cf_app_instance:"-" x_forwarded_host:"-" x_custom_host:"-" x_ssl_client:"-" x_ssl_client_session_id:"-" x_ssl_client_verify:"-" x_ssl_client_subject_dn:"-" x_ssl_client_subject_cn:"-" x_ssl_client_issuer_dn:"-" x_ssl_client_notbefore:"-" x_ssl_client_notafter:"-" x_cf_forwarded_url:"-" traceparent:"-" true_client_ip:"-" x_cf_true_client_ip:"X.X.X.X" x_request_id:"-" x_b3_traceid:"c503eb89990745827ce691a6c605e2cb" x_b3_spanid:"7ce691a6c605e2cb" x_b3_parentspanid:"-" b3:"c503eb89990745827ce691a6c605e2cb-7ce691a6c605e2cb"

The manifest of the app gets loaded but when the connection to the service should get established i get the 401 error.

I have provided the destination name directly below the approuter inside of the mta.yaml(when I deploy the destination is also in the User-Provided Variables):

- name: kdtaskprocessor
   type: approuter.nodejs
   path: app/router
   properties:
    TENANT_HOST_PATTERN: ^(.*)-${default-uri}
   requires:
    - name: auth-service
    - name: repo-html-runtime
    - name: destination-service
    - name: mtx-module
      group: destinations
      properties:
       name: mtx-api # must be used in xs-app.json as well
       url: ~{mtx-url}
    - name: srv-module
      group: destinations
      properties:
       name: serviceapi # must be used in xs-app.json as well
       url: ~{srv-url}
       forwardAuthToken: true
   provides:
    - name: router-module
      properties:
       app-name: ${app-name}
       app-protocol: ${protocol}
       default-domain: ${default-domain}
       default-uri: ${default-uri}

Also have bound those destination from the router inside of the xs-app.json of my HTML5 Fiori Elements application:

{
	"welcomeFile": "/index.html",
	"authenticationMethod": "route",
	"routes": [
		{
			"source": "^/odata/v4/task-processor/(.*)$",
			"target": "/odata/v4/task-processor/$1",
			"destination": "serviceapi",
			"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
		},
		{
			"source": "^(.*)$",
			"target": "$1",
			"service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
			"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
		}
	]
}

I already have tried to integrate it inside of the destination service directly inside of the mta.yaml, but also no success.

- name: destination-service
   type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
   parameters:
    config:
     HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
     init_data:
      instance:
       existing_destinations_policy: update
       destinations:
        - Name: serviceapi
          Description: Destination Service Module
          URL: ~{srv-module/srv-url}
          Type: HTTP
          ProxyType: Internet
          Authentication: NoAuthentication
          HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
          HTML5.ForwardAuthToken: true
          forwardAuthToken: true
     version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-name: kdtaskprocessor-dest-${org}
    service-plan: lite
   requires:
    - name: srv-module

All services are also bound to the application, attachment (SubscriptionDependencies.png).

Do you maybe have a clue why i am getting this 401 Unauthorized error?

Thanks for everyone which tries to help üôÇ

Regards,
Max

entry.title: Re-use a deployed HTML5 app in a new application with managed Application router
entry.content:
I'm currently working on understanding how SAP Build workzone using managed application router works.

I've used this as the boilerplate code :multi-cloud-html5-apps-samples/managed-html5-runtime-basic-mta at main ¬∑ SAP-samples/multi-cloud-html5-apps-samples ¬∑ GitHub

Within this I have added a backend module (Nodejs) with the route setup as below which targets a destination 'backend-api' that I have configured using destination service.

{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "/user-api/currentUser$",
      "target": "/currentUser",
      "service": "sap-approuter-userapi"
    },
    {
      "source": "^/api/(.*)$",
      "target": "/api/$1",
      "destination": "backend-api",
      "authenticationType": "none"
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    }
    
  ]
}

  This setup so far works fine.

Now, I want to re-use an HTML5 app that is already deployed in the subaccount that I'm currently working on.

I also want to configure xs-app.json in my application to view this UI.

I see the html5 app when I execute 'cf html5-list' in my target space. It is hosted on an HTML5 App repository service instance named 'sample-app-repo-dt' (app-host plan)

Can someone please help in guiding me or providing any existing documentation on how this can be done.

entry.title: HTML5 Apps launched form SAP build workzone site are not opening
entry.content:
Hello community,

I'm trying to launch my HTML5 application from build workzone. The application renders successfully when I open it from 'HTML5 Applications' in BTP cockpit subaccount.

However, after adding them to a business site in build workzone, the UI keeps loading and I see 500 errors in Component.js and Component-preload.js. I do not see this issue mentioned in the troubleshooting section of official doc.

Attaching a few screenshots for reference.

App stuck at this page while launching from build workzone site

Network calls and console:

 

 

 

Any suggestions on how to proceed will be appreciated. Thank you!

entry.title: Error on Logout event from SAP Build Work Zone in SAPUI5 page
entry.content:
I am trying to attach a callback to the Logout event from the SAP Build Work Zone in my SAPUI5 application, to then request a logout in my approuter application. This is the logic I added to enable the event:

// UI5 Component
export default class Component extends UIComponent {
	//...
	public init(): void {
		//...

		// Log out when the user clicks the logout button in the shell header (BWZ)
		Container.attachLogoutEvent(() => {
			console.log("Logout event triggered, redirecting to logout endpoint.");
			window.location.replace('/do/logout');
		}, false)
	}
}

 The callback is working on my local tests, and I can see the log message on the console. However, when I try to do same thing inside our SAP Build Work Zone subscription, the callback doesn't run and we see a error message:

 After investigating the source files I notices this error happens when the Logout Event is being created and a deprecated part of the code executes. I wasn't able to find any configurations on SAP Build Work Zone that would fix it, but I might have missed something?

Has anyone else seen this error before? How can I contact the SAP Build Work Zone team to get support?

Thanks

entry.title: HTML5 app not showing in BTP Cockpit After deployed
entry.content:
No error after upload, but the application still not showing in BTP Cockpit > HTML5 Applications.

Here is my MTA.yaml, i am not sure what needs to be adjusted.

_schema-version: 3.3.0
ID: SMDTR
description: A simple CAP project.
version: 1.0.0
modules:
- name: SMDTR-app-content
  type: com.sap.application.content
  path: .
  requires:
  - name: com.sm.dtr.h5host
    parameters:
      content-target: true
  build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
      - smdtrdtrapp.zip
      name: smdtrdtrapp
      target-path: resources/
- name: smdtrdtrapp
  type: html5
  path: app/smdtr.dtrapp
  build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
resources:
- name: com.sm.dtr.h5host
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-plan: app-host
- name: com.sm.dtr.destination
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      HTML5Runtime_enabled: false
      init_data:
        instance:
          destinations:
          - Authentication: NoAuthentication
            Name: ui5
            ProxyType: Internet
            Type: HTTP
            URL: https://ui5.sap.com
          existing_destinations_policy: update
      version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-plan: lite
parameters:
  deploy_mode: html5-repo
  enable-parallel-deployments: true
build-parameters:
  before-all:
  - builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm ci
    - npx cds build --production

entry.title: Issue CDN on Workzone Lauchpad with Referenced Fiori App - deploy on Cloud foundry
entry.content:
Hi Guys,

   We are facing issues with CDN ( Content Delivery Network ) on Workzone Lauchpad after deploy on Clound Foundry

    We  have an custom app that works great on BAS tests, but on dependencies we have this another central finance app:

"dependencies": {  "minUI5Version": "1.114.0",
"libs": {  "sap.fin.gl.lib.posting": {
"lazy": false
},

on BTP under HTML5 is Okay it was wrong, but after updating xs-app file they were solved so we have follow on xs-app:

  {
      "source": "^/resources/sap/fin/gl/lib/posting/(.*)$",
      "target": "/sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/fin_gl_post_lib/$1",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "destination": "MYDESTINATION"
    },
 
after adding it to Workzone Lauchpad it is still going to 
sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/1.136.2/resources/sap/fin/gl/lib/posting/library-preload.js   
Instead of going to the Backend to load this files.
 
We tried to add ResourceRoots like:
"resourceRoots": {
"sap.fin.gl.lib.posting": "./sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/fin_gl_post_lib"
},
 
But still going to wrong place.
 
Do you guys know how to fix it?
 
( its a mandatory requirement to have this app on BTP, We can not deploy it on backend )

@Wouter @FabioPagoti  any ideias? thankks

entry.title: Application Frontend Service with standalone approuter
entry.content:
Hi community,

I am exploring Application Frontend Service in a BTP trial account and now developing an MTA consisting of a standalone approuter, a UI module, and a CAP backend. Initially, I configured the UI to use the HTML5 Application Repository to ensure it worked properly.

Then, I switched to using Application Frontend Service , referencing to the document.

Although the deployment was successful, accessing the UI through the approuter resulted in a 404 error. The initial xs-app.json of the application router was:

{
  "welcomeFile": "miyasutabooksafs",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "srv-api",
      "csrfProtection": true
    }
  ]
}

In this configuration, requests to `miyasutabooksafs` were routed to the CAP application. Then, I modified the routes as follows:

{
  "welcomeFile": "miyasutabooksafs",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/odata/(.*)$",
      "target": "/odata/$1",
      "destination": "srv-api",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "app-front",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    }
  ]
}

However, this resulted in a deployment error of the approuter.

VError: xs-app.json/routes/1: Format validation failed (A route requires access to app-front service but the service is not bound.)

The application frontend service is bound to the approuter in mta.yaml.

  - name: srv-api
    group: destinations
    properties:
      forwardAuthToken: true
      name: srv-api
      url: ~{srv-url}
  - name: cap-afs-auth
  # - name: cap-afs-html5-runtime
  - name: cap-afs-afs # Application Frontend Service, developer plan

My GitHub repo: https://github.com/miyasuta/cap-afs/tree/appruntime

Question:

What is missing or incorrect in my configuration?
Any insights or working examples would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: HTML5 not visible in the BWZ
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

I am trying to deploy this template app from the SAP documentation through Cloud Foundry:
build-workzone-integration/standard/html5-content-provider-sample/ManageProducts at main ¬∑ SAP-samples/build-workzone-integration

and after building the mta.yaml and deplying the .mtar archive, it does not appear in the Build Work Zone, standard edition. 

I have modified the Destinations accordingly, and they appear in the cocktpit > Destinations. The app itself also appears in the cockpit > HTML5 Applications, and it runs smoothly. 

Yet, nothing appears in the Build work zone Content manager, or in the Content provider, even after a refresh.

I have noticed that I could add a new content provider, using the two Destinations generated during deployment, and that makes a role available, but no App, no catalog, and no group, as defined in the cdm.json. This content provider is thus not really useful, and anyway it defeats the purpose of deploying the app and its content through GACD. 


Has there been any changes in the objects that can be deployed with the cdm? The last modifications in the repo are 10 months old so it's possible, but I can't find anything about that in the documentation or the blog.

I've been stuck on this issue for the better part of the week, and while I think I have made some progresses, I'm still at loss about the root of the issue.

Thanks a lot for your guidance!

entry.title: Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData Annotation (Code Based)
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to create a Tree Table with Fiori Elements using SEGW, but I'm not able to do so.

I try to follow this posts:
Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData... - SAP Community
Fiori Elements Tree Table with SAP Annotations - SAP Community

This is my data table:

This are the fields:

 

These are my CDS Views:

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Intermediate View for Tree Structure'

define view entity ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ztree_table

{

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

nodename,

nodedescription

}

 

@EndUserText.label: 'Konsumptions-View f√ºr ZTREE_TABLE'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

//@OData.publish: true

@UI.headerInfo: {

typeName: 'Knoten',

typeNamePlural: 'Knoten'

}

@Hierarchy.parentChild: [{

name: 'TreeHierarchy',

recurse: {

parent: ['parentid'],

child: ['id']

},

siblingsOrder: [{

by: 'nodename',

direction: #ASC

}],

rootNode: {

visibility: #ADD_ROOT_NODE_IF_DEFINED

},

orphanedNode: {

handling: #ROOT_NODES

}

}]

define view entity ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

{

 

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Node Name' }]

nodename,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Node Description' }]

nodedescription

}

 

 

In SEGW I created a project and the did a right click on "Data Model"  then "Reference" / "Data Source" and chose my ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE. Icreated the runtime objects and redefined the method "define" in my *MPC_EXT class with the following code:


METHOD define.
  super->define( ).

  DATA: lr_entity    TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_entity_typ,
        lr_property  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_property,
        lr_annotation TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotation.

  lr_entity = model->get_entity_type( iv_entity_name = 'ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTUREType' ).
  IF lr_entity IS BOUND.

    " 1. id als Knoten-ID
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'id' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 2. RELATKEY als Parent Node
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'parentid' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_parent_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 3. SeqNo als Hierarchieebene
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'hierlevel' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_level_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 4. drill_state als Drill-Down-Zustand
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'drilldownstate' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_drill_state_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

If I create then the Responsive Table in the BAS, it shows me my data correctly. When I change to type "TreeTable", it shows me "No data found".

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks and best regards
Thomas

@MR_srinivas 
@SumitKundu 
@jmalla

entry.title: BUILD Work Zone - HTML5 Business Solutions vs HTML5 apps using saas_approuter
entry.content:
I just came across the idea of HTML5 Business Solutions in SAP Work Zone.

Developing HTML5 Business Solutions as Content Providers | SAP Help Portal

Federation of HTML5 Business Solutions | SAP Help Portal

Checking the use cases, it feels that this is target for partner apps when it comes to multitenancy. However there is the possibility to create single tenant apps. 

Based on that I have a few general questions: 

1) Is it possible to create a single tenant solution containing only the front end part of an app? (similar to a HTML5 app using saas_approuter)? If yes, what would be the advantages/main differences on doing so? Any sample repositories are appreciated.

2) A bit of futurology, is it possible that HTML5 apps created using saas_approuter will be deprecated in favor of HTML5 Business Solutions? I ask that mainly after Roadmap item "Automatic content refresh for integrated HTML5 applications after update" not targeting saas_approuter but only Business Solutions

If anyone from SAP can explain what was the concept behind Business Solutions, specially a single tenant scenario are very appreciated. Are such apps internally handled differently? Is there any relevant difference on the managed router of such scenarios?

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: unable to see in HTML5 Application in SAP BTP COCKPIT Subaccount
entry.content:
Can you please share what are the steps you have followed for the above Issue?

I'm also facing the same issue/error.

entry.title: Navigation Issue in CAP UI5 Apps on BTP CF Fiori Launchpad After Page Refresh
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are building several CAP-based UI5 applications deployed on BTP Cloud Foundry.

When these applications run inside the Fiori Launchpad (FLP), we encounter a navigation issue: if a user refreshes the page explicitly, they are unable to navigate back using either the browser‚Äôs back button or the Launchpad‚Äôs NavBack button (next to the SAP home icon). Initially, the user remains stuck on the current page (the browser hash doesn‚Äôt change either). After a few clicks, they are suddenly redirected straight to the FLP home page.

There are no errors/warnings/info in the browser's console log.

This issue does not occur when the same UI5 apps are run in standalone mode (accessed via the HTML5 Applications tab in the BTP Cockpit), nor does it affect Fiori Elements apps running in FLP.

Here‚Äôs how we handle navigation and routing in our UI5 app view controllers (TypeScript):

Navigating Forward

// params are routing parameters such as mandatory parameter
public navToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {});
}

Example usage:

public onNavToNextView(): void {
    this.navToView("nextView");
}

We even added a nav back button, but it has the same problem as well.

Navigating Back

// same, params is just an obj for routing parameters
public navBackToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    const history = History.getInstance();
    const previousHash = history.getPreviousHash();

    if (previousHash !== undefined) {
        window.history.go(-1);
    } else {
        this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {}, true);
    }
}

Example usage:

// press event for nav back button
public onNavBack(): void {
    this.navBackToView("previousView");
}

This is how we initialise the router in the Component.ts file:

this.getRouter().initialize();

This is the routing configuration in the manifest.json file:

"routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "myapp.view",
        "async": true,
        "bypassed": {
          "target": "notFound"
        }
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteHome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": ["TargetHome"]
        },
        {
          "pattern": "login",
          "name": "login",
          "target": "login"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "TargetHome": {
          "id": "Home",
          "name": "Home",
          "level": 1
        },
        "login": {
          "viewName": "Login",
          "viewId": "login",
          "level": 1
        },
        "notFound": {
          "id": "notFound",
          "name": "NotFound",
          "transition": "show"
        }
      }
    }

 

Are we missing something in our implementation? We‚Äôve followed UI5 examples from the Demo Kit. Could this be a known or unknown issue/bug with FLP itself?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: HTML5 Application Logging in BTP Cocpit - Neo Environment
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I‚Äôm currently working on an SAPUI5 HTML5 application deployed in the SAP BTP Neo environment, and I‚Äôve encountered an issue with logging.

I‚Äôve implemented client-side logging using the standard SAPUI5 logging API:

sap.ui.define(["sap/base/Log"], function(Log) {
    Log.error("An error occurred", "Detailed error message", "my.app.Component");
});

After deploying the application, I expected these logs to appear in the SAP BTP Neo Cockpit -> Monitoring -> Logs section. However, I‚Äôm not seeing any of the custom logs there. I‚Äôve verified that the application is running correctly and that the logs do appear in the browser console during runtime.

I also noticed that the Application Logging Service is not available in my Neo subaccount, which limits my options for centralized logging.

My Questions:

  1. Are client-side logs from SAPUI5 apps automatically captured in the Neo Cockpit?
  2. Is there a recommended way to push custom logs from HTML5 apps to the Cockpit in Neo?
  3. Are there any alternative logging mechanisms or services available for Neo HTML5 apps?
  4. Has anyone successfully implemented a workaround or custom logging integration?

Any guidance, suggestions, or examples would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Ramesh K

entry.title: How to use local copy parameters html5 application on work zone advanced such as adding variant ID
entry.content:
Hello,

We have Work Zone Advanced and have built and deployed various HTML5 apps via Business Application Studio running on Cloud Foundry using OData v4. No backend content to systems such as S/4HANA, all local to BTP. 

We are creating local copies of the deployed dynamic applications to manage dynamic content for counters and titles. We are attempting to have the applications open with preselected filters but are having issues. 

  1. Cannot use operators or regular expressions for filtering fields and sorting in the parameters with the content manager local copy of the application.
    • We have attempted various ways in both the Navigation and Visualization tabs for setting filter and sorting with only success with single values and equals as the operator. For example, we cannot find a way to filter for filter = <empty>
  2. As an alternate method we attempted to follow instructions to map a variant as part of the parameters, however this was also not successful.
    • We collected the variant id from dev tools > network > changes?sap-language=en and collecting the filename such as 
      • fileName: "id_1754739886907_236_flVariant"
      • fileType: "ctrl_variant"
      • layer: "PUBLIC"
    • We followed the guides to add the parameter variable such as sap-ui-fe-variant-id and others in the link below as well as variantKey, however none of which worked. This could be due to potentially a wrong variant id however we only see one fileName captured in the Network during a variant save event as described above. 
      • https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/468a97775123488ab3345a0c48cadd8f/4132ffa02f1148058a78dfb11c8567b0.html 

 

The guidance and documentation on the usages of the navigation and visualization parameters within the work zone advance content manager UI is not clear. The general question is there clear guidance on how to setup parameters, what parameters can be used, how to open the app with a defined variant etc.?

entry.title: Approuter: Error getting client_credentials
entry.content:
We operate a multi-tenant solution on SAP BTP and rely on the @sap/approuter package as our initial entry-point which connects to the portal service and a number of Fiori Elements HTML5 applications hosted using html5-apps-repo services. This is a setup we have used for many years without any issue.

We recently bumped the version of the approuter package from 16.4.x to the 20.6.1 and after deploying this change in our production environment, we started getting reports of intermittent issues loading HTML5 apps:

I inspected the approuter logs and found that we had a number of errors matching this format:

Error getting client_credentials token for html5-apps-repo-rt from subaccount <tenant-subdomain>: 
HTTP response from https://<tenant-subdomain>.authentication.us10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token was 401: 
{"error":"invalid_client","error_description":"Bad credentials"}.

 I referred back to the CHANGELOG.md for the approuter package and noticed that there had recently been some changes related to client credentials. I also noticed that a new version of the package was available (20.7.0) included a fix related to client_credentials and saas which I thought might address the issue we were experiencing:

- Read grant_type and saas.registry.enabled from service credentials in client_credentials token flow

We applied this update but are still experiencing the same behavior. 

I recognize that jumping multiple major versions (16->20) of a package has the potential for unexpected outcomes but the CHANGELOG.md did not have any indications that changes between any of these versions introduced major breaking changes. 

If anyone can provide any insights on how to proceed, it would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: UI5 Application works from BAS, but from HTML5 Repo, it gives 404 Error
entry.content:
Hi There,

Good day !
We are migrating our exiting Freestyle Ui5 applications from NEO to CF.

As part of migration process, we imported the app in BAS, configured oData destination, prefix etc.
The app and oData calls work when running it from BAS.

When deploy from BAS to CF, we could see the app in HTML5 repository, also 3 service instances with 4 service keys altogather.
When I try to run the app from CF (HTml5 Repo, app URL link), I get 404 errors for metadata load, and thus the app load is failing.
Following several answers in checked mta, ui5.yaml etc from web, I did removed "/" prefix, applied prefix etc, nothing worked.

I did check, the backend destination, path, prefix, url in ui5.yaml didn't find anything wrong.
The difference I see in metadata call is

From BAS successful : https://port8080-workspaces-ws-xl2uw.XXXXXX.applicationstudio.cloud.sap/<Neodestination prefix>/odata/<serviceName>/$metadata?sap-client=500&sap-language=EN

From HTML5 Repo un-successful: https://cloudfoundry-<XXXXX>.launchpad.cfapps.<XXXXX>..hana.ondemand.com/<GUID>.<APPNAME>.<APPNAME>-<Version#>/<Neodestination prefix>/odata/sap/<serviceName>/$metadata?sap-language=6N

Tried multiple ways of splicing the failed url removing app name etc, nothing worked

Not sure what am I doing wrong.

Any help in this regard is highly appreciated.

 

Thank you,

Sai

entry.title: How to authorize a CF-deployed HTML5 app via a Content Package role in SAP Build Work Zone (Standard
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm a junior SAP developer working with SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, and I‚Äôm running into difficulties with content packages.

Here‚Äôs my current setup:

  • I deployed a custom UI5 application via Cloud Foundry from BAS (cf deploy application.mtar).

  • I‚Äôm managing roles, tiles, spaces, and pages through a Content Package.

What works so far:

  • I can deploy custom tiles from the content package.

  • I can configure intent-based navigation (inbounds) to launch my app.

Where I‚Äôm stuck:

  • I cannot get authorization to work for the HTML5 app via a custom role.

  • I don‚Äôt know the correct way to reference the CF-deployed HTML5 app so that it can be added to the list of authorized apps in my content package role.

  • Currently, it only works if I assign the app to the Everyone role, which of course is not secure.

My current package looks like this:
content-package/

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ card/
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ all the files necessary for a custom card (working fine)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cdm/
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ apptodeploy.json
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page.json
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ role.json
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ space.json
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ content.json
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.json

I've referenced the app I'm trying to access to using its SAPUI5 Component Name (same as its id), as it appears in the content manager. I've exported the app from the CM and noted that its full name in the exported file is saas_approuter_appID, so I've tried that too, to no avail. And I've tried to create a businessapp in /cdm/apptodeploy.json in order to create a sort of placeholder for the app so that I can reference it, but to no avail either.

Question(s):
Is there a best practice for exposing CF-deployed HTML5 apps in a Content Package (CDM), so they can be authorized via custom roles? Has anyone implemented this workflow successfully? Any examples, documentation, or working patterns would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!
